RuDJ3Prk5mdvQ-FhD7_MmA.text: Polentoni has been on my radar for some time. I had popped in briefly before Christmas seeing all the lovely goodies on offer (I was very hungry) but the place was packed so I thought I would return another time.  Today, midweek, was a better time. I ordered a toasted porchetta sandwich (slow roasted pork belly nested on a red pepper sauce / jam). The bread was focaccia.  Moments later, when the sandwich was brought to me, I was in food heaven. Seriously good sandwich, savoury and bit sweet at the same time (the red pepper jam) - all flavours mingled together really well. The sanwich came with some 'good quality' crisps on the side.   Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sandwiches

XVMkY6DlQThwaGuKiDAfSA.text: Lovely quick lunch, tasty dishes, fresh orange juice, fairly priced, quick and nice service what else do you need?  Crispy polenta with toppings was perfect, fresh, well seasoned, super tasty, Just couldn't fault it.

photos.caption: Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Crispy polenta, topped with smoked mozzarella, asparagus, spinach and cherry tomatoes.

l5uNifTEUU-7qX_gcQs4Hw.text: Was staying around the corner for my last visit to Edinburgh. Wow, their brunch is amazing! I had the crispy polenta topped with mushroom, spinach and a poached egg. My husband had the smoked salmon with a poached egg. I also had been eyeing the desserts in the case and took the chocolate, almond polenta cake home. I wish I had more...

JvI05oc6-pHjZ1900ynXKg.text: This tiny cafe is an absolute delight.  At the top of Easter Road, it is contributing to the continuing improvement of the area.  As the name suggests the cuisine is Italian but don't expect any pizzas.  The counter display of home-made foccaccia and panini stuffed with good things (think roasted aubergine, goats cheese, salami milano etc) is only the beginning.  The small daily changing menu offers  delights such as inventive pasta dishes and arancini.   The coffee, as you would expect from an authentic Italian venue, is good and water is brought to the table when you sit down. Friendly staff and a real local vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

DlKWoQRHHhWJc1gm7e7zNQ.text: I've been eyeing up this place for a while, but with so many other excellent lunch or cake cafes around it took a while! I came in on a saturday around 4 to have a late lunch. I had some kind of mozzerella pancetta creation, which was amazing. Paired with a cappuchino this only came down to a fiver, so it's excellent value!  Because I'm a European, I do like a dessert after my lunch, and I opted for the almond raspberry tart. It was very tasty, not too dry as you might expect. This place will give the Manna House a run for its money! There is good chilled music on and some local art on the walls which i always think is cool, but if that doesn't tick your box why not stare at the italian delicatessen,  sausages and cheese on show! The staff is friendly and quick and the clientele are mostly locals. I'll be back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zCNP6Ri8LFLwVlff9l3w1w.text: We had an AMAZING brunch at Polentoni. Although they only serve breakfast until 12pm, they served us at 1pm. It would be great if they could offer an all day brunch. The breakfast menu is innovative with an Italian twist and nothing I've seen in Edinburgh before. I had poached eggs with spinach, and mozzarella melted on polenta bread (fried bread/hash brown texture). Just divine and probably the best breakfast I've had in Edinburgh! The coffee was also great too. The cafe is very small with only a couple of tables, but it's really worth the wait. An awesome addition to Easter Road!

photos.caption: Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

hqaW_E3vUja6e7UZXYro0A.text: Quite simply best cafe for breakfast in Edinburgh - not your usual Scottish fare but excellent Italian dishes.  Beautiful omelettes, asparagus wrapped in parma ham, scrambled egg bruschetta.  Decent coffee too.  For lunch an incredible selection of fresh ciabattas, focaccias, saltimboccas etc filled with hams, cheeses, mushrooms etc.  The cakes are tasty and varied with brownies and crumble cake a favourite.  Deli counter.  Very friendly service and Wi-Fi.

photos.caption: Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Polentoni do evening service. Occasional but worth tracking down.
Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. House porchetta!

EdOSjzT9QbXGV7JDAirzrA.text: I'd been keeping an eye on Polentoni for the last couple of weeks, eagerly awaiting its opening. A new Italian deli/cucina but a stone's throw from my new flat? How could I not be excited?!  Well, on my way to work last week and finally, Polentoni had opened. There was no fan fare, no 'OPEN NOW' signs, it was just open. I browsed the breakfast and lunch menus displayed in the window and was it was decided, this was definitely a good thing. And so the very next day, on a rare weekend off together, Kip S and I ventured forth to try out our neighbourhood's newest offering.  Sadly we were too late for breakfast, which they stop serving at 11.30am, so we had a spot of lunch instead. There's a menu of mains, salads and sandwiches to choose from, with takeaway available. A young family were finishing up their lunch, ordering more tiny little Italian biscuits for the kids, and a number of people came in for takeaway coffee. We opted to share one of the mains, a selection of fried aubergine, squid and prawns with a garlicky dip, and ordered from the selection of savoury pastries and bites. Kip had a mushroom frittata and I had a barley risotto arancini. We were asked if we'd like these heated up, yes, and my only gripe, which I'll happily put down to teething issues, was that they were still cold on the inside. That and arancini is always better fresh (and with rice), but hey I knew that when I ordered it! The aubergine, squid and prawns though were delicious. I could easily have eaten the portion to myself, but that would have been greedy.  Oh, and the coffees were good. There's a really nice selection, more than just your usual latte and cappuccino. I can foresee myself popping up to grab one to takeaway most weekends.  And I forgot to mention! Polentoni is a deli, so there's a smallish selection of meats and cheeses to buy, in addition to savoury pastries and sweet biscuits and cakes.  Welcome to the neighbourhood, we're happy to have you!

photos.caption: Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Polentoni - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

qHgNP2k_HJdYDlGpL19AZA.text: Excellent food! Great place to get gifty food items to take as presents. Always busy, and if they got a bigger space it would fill up too! Great for take aways. Serves breakfast and lunch. Everything from soup, sandwiches, pasta dishes, etc. Great desserts! Authentic Italian! Owners are great, very friendly, caring and hardworking!!! Grazie!!!

gvVct5Vtmr27O_-rUClphw.text: Genuinely good Italian cafe which now means the top of Easter Road becomes an unlikely centre of culinary and alcoholic excellence with Manna House and Cornelius within metres.  Great breakfast menu - last time I had scrambled egg bruschetta with my better half having the asparagus wrapped in parma ham with poached egg.  Great lunch menu too - filled rolls, mini pizza.  Very pleasant service, well prepared, fresh food. Tastes great. Coffee is quality too along with fine cakes.  Thoroughly recommend this delightful cafe.

NITFBQjTXt9ilPkLbVo5pQ.text: We are so happy to have this new deli/cafe in the the neighbourhood! Not only is the service friendly (and child-friendly), the food is delicious. I've sampled everything from sandwiches to brownies to lovely little biscuits that go perfectly with tea or coffee. We've been using the place a lot this summer as the perfect spur-of-the-moment picnic solution -- should we make some sandwiches? Or hey, should we grab pizza slices and treats from Polentoni!!?? Not to mention that I had a fantastic latte from there yesterday. As the first reviewer said, welcome to the neighbourhood!
